intro: Brachychiton discolor, commonly known as the flame tree, is a striking tropical tree native to northern Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are typically green with red or purple veins. The plant produces large, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often appearing in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release its seeds. Brachychiton discolor is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient and ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
